response:
Subacute onset over 11 days of a Brown-Sequard-type high cervical myelopathy in a middle-aged man most strongly suggests a structural compressive lesion, but inflammatory demyelinating myelitis, epidural abscess, and intramedullary tumor remain important alternatives as they require different acute treatments.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right C3\u2013C5 cervical disc herniation causing hemicord compression", "Cervical spondylotic myelopathy with asymmetric right hemicord compression", "Inflammatory demyelinating cervical myelitis (multiple sclerosis or neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder)", "Cervical spinal epidural abscess", "Cervical intramedullary spinal cord tumor (ependymoma or astrocytoma)"]
